CatDescriptText: Mrs. Jean Slater, 3110 Avalon Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that the proposed six-day-a-week school attendance, as proposed by Governor Leader, is the answer to the Russian challenge in scientific education?" answer reads: "I don't think that it will be an answer to competition with Russia. I think that six days will be fine if the youngsters really learn the three R's...that is reading, writing, and arithmetic."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jean Slater, wearing light colored shirt and dark coat, holding papers, including one that reads "Hemington", standing next to man in front of block building with sign that reads "Cocktail Lounge" with image of marlin
